Items.Name: 100% silk ivory evening jacket size 8 10
Items.Location: San Francisco Oakland Bay Area CA
Items.Description: This ivory or offwhite heavy silk evening jacket is made by Jim Heilman in China. I would call this a unisex jacket, in that a woman could wear it as a wrap or evening jacket, and a smaller man could wear it as quite a "spiffy" smoking jacket. Very nice rounded, textured lapels. 40" bust, 40" waist, 2 pockets with bands that match the lapels, 18.5" inner sleeve, 24.5" outer sleeve, 18" around arm hole, 14" bicep, 15.5" across shoulder, 30.5" length. The light in the photo yellows the color, but it is actually a pure ivory or off-white shade. I think the third photo is the closest. Other than being slightly wrinkled, looks just "off the rack." There is a TINY ink mark on one sleeve. Chances of anyone even noticing that mark are slim, and it will most probably come out with dry cleaning. Also, under the same sleeve, there are some 3 tiny dark dots that may have come from either an ink or straight pin. Again, they are under the arm, and they will most probably come out when dry cleaned. At this price, it is worth the investment to get a fine quality custom silk jacket. Items.Description: Welcome to Christmas 365 Days a Year Auctions Hello Bidders! All auctions start at $3.65 and keep an eye out for the $1.00 sale - these are items that are not in perfect condition, but still wearable. Click on an option: Item Description Item Details Winner Info Contact Me Customer Service Payment Info Shipping Info About Christmas 365 Click on the photo for full view. If you are the winning bidder... 1. I will send you an email at the end of the auction's close. 2. Please respond to this email within 5 business days. 3. After the close of the auction, payment is expected within 14 days. If payment has not been received within 14 days after the close of the auction, you will be reported to Safe Harbor, banned from all of Christmas 365 future auctions, negative feedback posted, and the item relisted for sale. 4. If you wish to pay by credit card (not PayPal) - email me your request and I will forward you the link to my secure credit card form from BillPoint. (Please do not send me your credit card number!) 5. For multiple bids on auctions - I will hold items until you are finished bidding to save on shipping. Just let me know that you are bidding on multiple auctions - I will send you the regular end of auction emails, and when you are finished, let me know and I will package all items together and get you a final total. Payment Information Personal Checks: Personal checks must clear before I will ship the item. Checks typically take 7 business days to clear. Money Orders: Money orders or cashiers checks are prefered over personal checks. Credit Cards: If you choose to pay with credit card, you may: 1.) Go to PayPal.com and initiate payment there using xmas365@mindspring.com as the email address, or 2.) I will send you a secure credit card invoice from BillPoint . Shipping Information United States Postal Service: I ship all items through the United States Postal System. I have found that they are the cheapest and the most effective, especially for international orders. Priority Mail: Listed below are my shipping rates (which includes handling) for Priority Mail. Most items run the $5.00 rate. Keep in mind that jeans and suit outfits can be heavy and run $6.50 or more to ship. Up to 1 lbs. - $4.50 Up to 2 lbs. - $5.00 Up to 3 lbs. - $6.50 Up to 4 lbs. - $7.75 Up to 5 lbs. - $9.25 Over 5 lbs. - I will include the cost in the email that is sent at the end of the auction. First Class/Parcel Post and International Mail: If you wish to have your item shipped Parcel Post/First Class for cheaper rates - just let me know and I will get you the cost for shipping your item that way. It usually runs anywhere from $.15 to $1.00 cheaper depending on the size of the item. If you live outside of the United States, notify me with your address. I will get a few quotes on rates/delivery times and will let you decide which option you prefer. (United States Postal Service is the cheapest.) Contact Me Christmas 365 Days a Year Please email me with any questions you may have and I will respond as quickly as I can. Customer Service Disclaimers: As with all used items there will be some general wear to the garment. USED clothing have been cleaned , but with any clothing items that you buy from ebay or a store, it is recommended that items be recleaned to your satisfaction. All measurements given are as close as possible, but may not be exact. Please use these as a guideline. Pictures are as exact as technology allows, if there is some major difference between the picture shown and the actual item, a description of the difference will be listed in the ad. Shipping: Winners of multiple auctions can have their items combined to save on shipping costs. Refunds: Full refunds (including shipping costs to send and return the item) will be given if the buyer feels that the seller has some how misrepresented an item. Refunds will not be applied until the item is returned and received by the seller. Partial refunds (not including the shipping cost to send or return the item) for general dislike or size will be given, since pictures and/or measurements are given for each item. Refunds will not be applied until the item is returned and received by the seller. Please let me know if you do have a problem with an item received (I can't catch every flaw on every item.) Returns: If an item is returned, it MUST be in the same condition as when it left. Item refunds may also be applied as credit towards future purchases. About Christmas 365 Days a Year Every day is Christmas when you bid on items from ebay! Waiting for those packages to arrive in the mail, and once they arrive; opening them to see what new item you have added to your collection!! To find out more about me and Christmas 365 Days a Year check out my About Me page. Thanks for Stopping By! Bidder.Location: It's beginning to look a lot like Christmas!
LOOK AT ALL MY OTHER AUCTIONS

Items.Description: Copyright Disclosures Hi, most of you are probably not aware, but copying of a seller's original text or photo from an auction is an infringement on their copyright. The following are guidelines and rules disclosed by eBay: Contrary to popular belief, the fact that material is posted on the world wide web does not mean it is in the "public domain" or otherwise free to be taken, copied or used by others......... eBay Guideline: No copying allowed! When you prepare your auction listings you generally should use only material ( text , photographs , etc.) and trademarks/names that you created or own yourself or licensed from the owners. Here are some examples of potentially infringing auctions: You copy someone else's auction text and (without permission) paste it into your own auction to sell the same item (Making slight modifications to the text may not relieve you of liability if it is substantially similar to the original text). We do not authorize copying of any text or photos from our auctions. For more information on copyrights & trademarks, please go to the "Help" section on eBay. Incredible Bridal Gown with 6-Layer Skirt ~ Size 16-20 This "BRAND NEW" (it was not a store sample and has never been tried on), bridal gown is so INCREDIBLE. The gown features a Queen Anne neckline trimmed with exposed lace edging. The form fitted bodice is adorned with exquisite cord lacing accented with sewn on pearl beading, sequins and seed beads. The illusion back features matching lace and beading, it closes with satin buttons that really button and a zipper at the bottom. The flattering basque waistline is draped with absolutely gorgeous lace and flows to beautiful tulle ballgown skirt accented with matching lace and beading. The skirt is trimmed at the hem with scalloped lace and flows to a stunning Cathedral train. This gown is fully lined with built in netting ~ an additional crinoline is recommended if a fuller skirt is desired (as shown in photos). ML69201356 The low reserve on this gown is not the "buy it now" price. It is just high enough to allow the "buy it now" option to be available for the first couple of days of the auction. Features: Color: White Fabric: Satin Top and Tulle Skirt Neckline: Queen Anne Sleeves: Short Ballgown with built in crinoline Train: Cathedral Approximate Measurements: (according to the mfg's sizing chart) Bridal Gown Size: 18 Bust: 41.5 Waist: 33 Hips: N/A Total Seam Allowance: 3" Bridal sizes do not correspond to your regular dress size, each manufacturer has it's own sizing chart. Please use the above measurements as guidelines to ensure proper fit. Most gowns have a 1" seam allowance on each side (total 2"), and can be easily altered to at least two sizes down or one size up. Please remember that wedding gowns are fitted garments and most need some alterations for proper fit. Please click here to see photos of my other eBay gowns!! About the Gowns: Brand New Gown ~ A "Brand New" gown is a gown that has never been displayed and never been tried on. It is in mint condition. A few loose treads or beads may be possible. New Gown ~ A "New" gown has never been altered or worn to a wedding. It was probably a store model and tried on a few times (much like the clothing we buy at department stores) . It may have a few loose beading, but do not appear to have any noticeable spots, makeup smudges, tears or rips (some minor blemishes from normal dressing room wear may be possible ~ like on the skirt hem) ~ it will not need to be dry-cleaned. Any noticeable spots or flaws will be mentioned in the description. It may also be a Production Sample ~ designers sometimes make different variations of the same gown prior to production. Therefore, Production Samples are Brand New gowns that are the 1st or 2nd cuts prior to production, sometimes used as a designer showroom sample (not tried on) or an original one of a kind! Photos: Due to amateur lighting and photography, the photos may not reflect the exact color of the gown. When applicable, please refer to the catalog (professional) photos for more accurate details. Steaming : Most gowns will need to be steamed before wearing as the gowns get creased and wrinkled from being packaged and during shipping. Steaming is usually done after alterations by the seamstress. Terms and Conditions: Serious Bidders Only Please!! ~ If you have any questions, please ask before bidding. Please place your bids accordingly ~ I get many after auction e-mails from heartbroken brides who thought they won the gown of their dreams. They find out during the last few seconds they were outbid and don_t have time to place another bid. Many auctions are won by experienced bidders who bid during the last 30 seconds of the auction. We apologize, but we only ship to the U.S. and Canada, so please don't bid and then ask me to ship overseas after the auction . Payment: "Buy it Now" ~ If you choose to close the auction using the "Buy it Now" option, you must be prepared to pay for the gown within 48 hours of the close of the auction. Payment for all others are due within 10 days . I glady accept payments by MasterCard , Visa and Money Order (I do not use Paypal or Billpoint). Due to the nature of bridal apparel ~ all sales are final. Shipping: I ship every Monday and Thursday . Buyer pays fixed shipping fee as follows: $15.00 for UPS Ground shipping in the U.S. (except for Alaska, Hawaii and Guam). $20.00 for USPS Priority Mail shipping to Guam . $25.00 for UPS Standard shipping to Canada. We apologize, but we do not ship to any other countries, so please don't bid . Buyer is responsible for any applicable Canadian taxes, sorry, but we cannot falsify our invoice. Alaska and Hawaii ~ rates vary depending on your zip code and available services ~ I'd be happy to give you a quote, just let me know your shipping zip code. $6.00 for UPS' COD service (that is the flat rate UPS charges). All shipping fees include insurance coverage up to the value of the final bid price of the gown (we do not charge extra to insure your gown). To ensure proper packaging and handling, payment must be received before noon the day prior to shipping (e.g., payment for Thursday's shipment must be received before noon on Wednesday). If you prefer a different shipping method, please let me know in advance so that I can advise you of the price and availability. UPS DOES NOT deliver to P.O. Box and APO addresses. Combined Shipping - I love repeat customers and offer 50% off U.S. shipping rate at $7.50 for each gown after the first. $12.00 for Alaska, Hawaii, Guam and Canada. There is not limit on the number of gowns, they just need to be shipped at the same time. All gowns have been protected and will be shipped in a brand new zippered bridal garment bag (valued at up to $15). Thanks for looking and good luck bidding! California residents please add 8% sales tax. Bid & Buy with Confidence ~ We are eBay PowerSellers! Winning Bidder: If you are the winning bidder : Please DO NOT complete this transaction using eBay's CHECKOUT . We will contact you via e-mail within 24 hours with detailed instructions on how to complete this transaction. Items.Name: Black/Peacock &Pink Cultured Pearl Choker,14K
Items.Description: Welcome To Avante Studios ! We are second-generation jewelers with over 45 years combined experience in fine gold, gemstone & pearl jewelry....... In this listing we are offering another stunning Avante Studio original: 7.5mm Black Pearls with rich peacock overtones, combined with 4.5mm Pink Pearls. The luster of the pearls in this unique choker is Excellent (highly reflective), the color is Black with rich peacock overtones and Shell Pink, the surface quality is Excellent (lightly circled), and the Grade is AA. The nacre thickness of these pearls is better than 95%. Retail value $575.00. The necklace is choker length of 15.5" and is professionally handknotted on doubled silk, with a 14K filligree clasp.... Much prettier than the pictures, which don't adequately convey the beautiful colors. These are Cultured Freshwater Pearls from Lake Biwa, Japan. You can make no better choice in cultured freshwater pearls than those from Lake Biwa, due to unusual saltiness of the Lake that produces pearls closely comparable in hardness and quality to ocean pearls. Japanese pearls have long been celebrated as being the finest freshwater pearls available & still hold that title today. Lake Biwa Pearls are being produced again, due to importation of Kasumigaura mussels and environmental improvements to the Lake. Biwa Pearls will maintain their beautiful luster and shape for a lifetime without fading, cracking, peeling or discoloring, which can happen to other pearls. We can offer such excellent prices on high quality jewelry because we buy direct, do all the work in our own studio and bring the item directly to you for a fraction of the retail cost. Accompanied by Certificate of Authenticity. Will arrive in a white gift box. Shipping is Priority Mail with confirmation tracking. RETURNS: you may return any item you are not completely satisifed with for a full refund within 7 days of receipt (minus shipping only). Paypal, Check or MO accepted. Items.Name: Georgetown Design - Ladies Leather Jacket 5/6
Items.Description: _ _ Ladies "Zig-Zag" Leather Jacket with Belt Georgetown Leather Design Wash. D.C. _ Size is marked as "5/6" 100% Leather Shell These measurements are provided so that someone can compare them to a jacket of their own. _ Width __ (shoulder to shoulder) = 15.5 inches _ Length __ (from back collar to bottom of jacket) = 28 inches Sleeves (from shoulder seam to cuff of sleeve) = 25.5 inches _ This leather jacket is pre-worn and it's really in great condition, way better than these fotos would suggest, the leather itself is very smooth yet fully flexible with very few, if any, natural blemishes._ There are two hand pockets on the lower front (one on each side) both are fully intact (no holes in pockets), the interior is a material lining and it is fully intact (no rips or tears), the "zig-zag" pattern on the front and the stripes on the sleeve are leather and sewn on, the belt is removeable, it has no buckle and is meant to be tied, the only thing "wrong" with this jacket is that the bottom of the cuffs have the absolute minimalist of "wear" on them, this jacket is really in great condition and a quick wipe down with a damp cloth will make it look practically brand new, the color of this jacket is slightly darker than it appears in these fotos (my camera isn't the best). I never wore this particular jacket but just found it, bought it and put it in a closet. _ This is gonna sound crazy but it's the truth - A couple of years ago I thought it would be a good idea to buy enough leather items to constitute a small herd of cows and then sell these leather goods on eBay, thus "saving" a small herd of living cows from being killed so their hides could be used for items like this, I know that this won't really happen (no matter how much I would like it to) and that animals are killed everyday regardless of my small effort but since I don't personally like the idea of killing animals (for any reason) I thought that recycling already manufactured leather goods was better than doing nothing at all, I said that was gonna sound crazy and maybe it is, but I don't care, most people think I'm nuts anyways._ I have nothing against anyone who would like to own this item, I only bought things that were in really good shape and that I found to be functionable and fashionable so I'm more than happy to try and find someone to help me out in this somewhat bizzare recycling project._ The bottom line is that I just think it's a better thing for us to make use of what we already have! These digital images aren't always of the highest colour quality or detail and this jacket will always look way better in-person. If the images above aren't showing up, try "clicking" on them and selecting the "view image" option. TERMS FOR TRADE PLEASE DO NOT BID ON THIS AUCTION IF YOU CAN'T MEET THESE TERMS FOR TRADE! I put this information up here so people can fully understand what they need to do in order to successfully complete this auction._ I'm 100% serious about all of this and I'd simply rather not waste my time and resources with any people who aren't, fair enough? PAYMENT Payment is due within 10 days of my sending the end of auction notification e-mail and by any one of these following methods. _ 1. U.S. Postal Order or Money Order (Canadian M.O.'s are OK too._ International bidders - We have to see what we can work out). _ 2. Verified Cashiers' Check (please note that this is drawn from a Bank and not a Personal Check). _ 3. Cleverly concealed currency, as long as it's well secured with tape and wrapped in paper or between card. _ 4. Through eBay Payments._ eBay Payments isn't really an "instant payment method" as it takes them approximately ____ 2-3 DAYS before they actually transfer those funds to my account and only at that point can I ship out an item. SHIPPING Within the Continental United States This item can be shipped by either method "A", "B" or "C"._ Closing Bidders must choose which method they prefer. The cost of shipping this item is going to depend on two things, the weight of the wrapped package and it's ZIP Code destination, my policy on shipping is that you pay what it costs to ship something and not a penny more. That said, these rates shown are for a package that weighs 1lb. or under, this item most likely weighs more than 1lb so these rates are just an example of the three different kinds of shipping that I offer, once a package's destination is known I can send you an accurate cost of shipping. A. Priority Mail - at it's basic flat rate, this is sent "no frills" via the USPS, with an est. 2 day delivery time = $3.50 B. Priority Mail - with Delivery Confirmation (this is not Insured), via the USPS, with an est. 2 day delivery time = $3.90 C. Priority Mail - with Postal Insurance, via the USPS, with an est. 2 day delivery time (this method is recommended) = $4.60 Outside the Continental United States International shipping costs are determined by the package's actual weight and it's final destination, these closing bidders will be e-mailed an accurate cost of shipping once the package's destination is known._ Overseas delivery times range from 4 to 10 days. ONCE THIS AUCTION HAS CLOSED I'll e-mail the closing bidder (usually within 24 hours), ask which method of payment and shipping they prefer and request the : Name , Mailing Address , Zip Code and/or Country that this package will be sent to._ Payment is due within 10 days of this e-mail notification and as stated by these terms of trade._ As a seller, my policy is to ship all items within 24 hours of their payment being received as well as keeping in contact with the bidder from the close of an auction to the receipt of merchandise._ My feedback policy on completed transactions is - "If you want some, leave some, because if you don't, I won't." ._ That might sound "wrong", but it has proven itself to work without a hitch considering I had been burned on feedback 200+ times before I adopted this approach and never since after._ Most eBayer's have been great about meeting these terms for trade and to them I give my thanks! _ I've been collecting music (records, tapes, cds, videos) as well as the artwork/text around and about it (tour programs, books, magazines, t-shirts, posters, patches, pins, flyers, etc.) for decades._ I've ended up with tons of stuff I don't have the room to continue storing and since it's not doing me any good just sitting here I've decided to pass it all along to others via eBay with the simple hope that someone "out there" can find something they've been looking for (or even better, didn't yet know existed) at a price that they think is reasonable along with service that is exceptional._ Check out my feedback to see how well past eBayer's think I've done so far. stukinflorida is addicted to vinyl, a devoted t-shirtologist and enjoys long walks on short piers. PLEASE NOTE If life is a bowl of cherries then deadbeat bidders are the pits!_ If a closing bidder fails to meet any of these terms for trade I'll simply void the auction, relist the item and promptly leave those fraudulent bidders the negative feedback they've justly earned._ Questions about this item or about these terms for trade?_ Send them my way and they'll be answered to the best of my ability._ Payment Details See item description and Payment Instructions, or contact seller for more information. Payment Instructions See item description or contact seller for more information.

When you touch the horse mark, it will disappear shortly and show up again. If you make a ligher fire approach to the horse mark for 3~4 seconds, the mark will disappear clearly. Then after 10 seconds, it will show up again. But still some cashmere products is still using tag w/ blue button. On this case, you have to check the logo "BURBERRY". ***** *****Third, Check label's position on the scarf. For example, if it is auth BURBERRY lambswool or cashmere scarf, the label's position is middle of first plaid exactly. Compare lable's position in below picture. authentic BURBERRY label on scarf is located middle of check * WHAT IS BEST WAY TO BUY auth 100% BURBERRY The Best way is to buy in offical BURBERRY shop or to find belivable store or dealer in your local area. When you buy some BURBERRY goods in internet like eBay, you must check above three way before you buy. Items.Description: if (navigator.appName == 'Microsoft Internet Explorer') { if (navigator.appVersion.substring(0,1) "); } else { document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" BODY { background: url(http://members.home.net/vmawema/whitemar.jpg) }"); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); } } else { //Default to Netscape settings. document.write(" "); } STUNNING HUGO BOSS CASHMERE SPORT COAT 46R ABSOLUTELY INCRDEIBLE HUGO BOSS CASHMERE SPORT COAT IN PRISTINE AS NEW CONDITION!!! You heard right...CASHMERE!!! Hugo Boss just never stops! He has brought you a coat worthy of royalty and ONLY WORN ONCE. The feeling of this coat... It's absolutely amazing! The material of this jacket is so impressive that it'll make you want to wear it all the time. Made by Hugo Boss of Italy, this hand - stitched specimen of quality leaves nothing to be criticised. It's a coat that's right off the rack of the finest suits ANYONE could offer! Wha t I really love about this coat is that is would be appropriate for just about ANY OCCASSION because it's color and pattern are conservative, yet sharp, and the texture of the fabric would work either in the office or out at Sunday brunch. With it's overall cool dark blue/ash - gray color, relaxed cut and form, notched lapels, single-vented back, slightly - padded square shoulders, chest and flap pockets, this garment just oozes with class...something only those with high appreciation for fine clothing should wear. Hugo Boss has long been known to be of the world's leaders when it comes to setting fashion trends, especially in the business and formal arenas. This suit represents the 'power/ wealth image' with it's crisp cut and sharp, yet comfortable edges. Hugo Boss is the unique combination of class, style and youth that portrays the image of one in command, in style and on the edge... where you've gotta be! Designed for the highest comfort level possible, this coat further displays it's quality and durability in the integration of grey and white swirling buffalo horn buttons, along with it's hand-stitched,silky-smooth lining. In fact THE ENTIRE GARMENT IS HAND - STITCHED IN SILK!!! With such detail paid to ensuring a suit's lifespan and aesthetic appeal, it shouldn't surprise you that the retail value of a similar coat could easily be $1200.00, but now you can get this piece for a small fraction of it's original price. Items.Name: nepal pashmina LAVENDER 36x80 very soft
Items.Description: Pashmina, from the Persian word for wool, is one of the greatest treasures ever to come out of the Himalayan kingdoms; it is one of the richest, rarest fibers in the world. Once known as "the fiber of the gods", it is possibly the softest, lightest and warmest wool nature has produced, and unlike any other wool, it actually gets softer with every time you wear it! Pashmina wool is part of the cashmere family, but it is even finer. It is shorn from the undercoat of the Himalayan mountain goat (Capri hircus) which is indigenous to the remotest regions of Tibet Plateau and Central Asia. Shawls and blankets have been woven from pashmina wool for over a thousand years, prized by kings, queens and common people alike for its warmth and long life. In fact, so treasured was pashmina, that maharajas, Kashmiris and the Tibetan Lords, kept it hidden from the western world until the late 18th century, instead trading in cashmere with its "rougher" fibers 80%pashmina 20% silk ,210 count 2 ply ,36x80 SIZE genuine pashmina direct form nepal quality gruantee . $8 shipping /handling in usa .
